main event: On 5th November 1950, in Jonesville, Louisiana, a family reported seeing hovering objects with bright whitish-blue lights that then disappeared at the speed of light.
interesting points: The witnesses estimated the object to be flying at an altitude of 10 miles and described it as cigar-shaped, about 25-40 feet long and 2-4 feet thick.
The objects were reported to be bright with a whitish-blue light, composed of bright lights that glinted like facets on a diamond.
The family observed the hovering objects with flashing lights at an estimated height of 50 feet over the trees.
No definite outline of the object's shape was observed, and it made no noise, left no visible exhaust, and did not conform to the appearance of normal aircraft.
The New Orleans Item reported on 17th October 1950 speculated about the sighting of an unidentified object in formation by Miami Airlines, Inc., pilots on 16th October 1950.
sighted object: hovering objects with bright whitish-blue lights
